top of the company". Larry Page, who founded the company with Sergey Brin , will now run the company in the CEO role with Eric Schmidt moving to an "executive chairman" position. Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's chief executive officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly, says Eric Schmidt before adding: "I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! Factor is well supported on both sides of the border. "I know from my experience of the Young Star Search there is no shortage of talent in Northern Ireland," he said. There will potentially be no representation from Ireland, north or south, which is a bit rich given how loyal people here are to the show. Simon Cowell has made no secret of the fact that he was underwhelmed by what Dublin had to offer- and it is believed to be under his orders that X Factor has axed the Irish leg.

President Bush Reagan official Ralph Benko, who ran a website that urged Mr. Mike Pence to seek higher office, tells me: Mike Pence has qualities that inspired unprecedented across-the-board enthusiasm among movement conservatives. I hope that he would accept an offer of the vice presidency from the eventual Republican nominee if called. Other conservative leaders I contacted all reacted with dismay to the Mike Pence news and feared that it moves Mr. Mitt Romney one step closer to the GOP nomination. In the first half, it was awful, so I came out early at halftime and tried to get my http://wn.com/Allen_Iverson_highlights_vs_Bucks_08/09_NBA_*Missed_Practice_Coming_off_the_bench_*Crossover_on_Lue One day after a missed practice landed him on the Detroit Pistons' bench, Allen Iverson spoke loudly with his play Friday night. Once he got the chance. Coming off the bench for the first time as a Piston, Allen Iverson scored 17 points and led Detroit to a 107-97 victory over the slumping Milwaukee Bucks. "With everything going on, I wanted to play well, Allen Iverson said. "I just wanted to play well. Especially for my teammates because I let them down by not being here." said to Regis Philbin . "I think it's a good idea. I think you're leaving at the top of your game." With David Letterman laughing, Martin Short pressed on with the obvious joke. It's a smart thing to do, because you've peaked, he said. And then he advised David Letterman to not "come back like Sinatra." Though it was inevitable, the humor was lost when David Letterman inevitably set the record straight and Martin Short feigned ignorance.
